title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Sensitive body wash for my twins
review_text:
The pump dispenser is a nice touch, making it convenient to use in the shower without the hassle of flipping open a cap. A small amount goes a long way, and it spreads smoothly across the body without feeling heavy or greasy. It’s also fragrance-free, which is a big plus for my twins because they are sensitive to perfumes in some skincare products. It provides a thorough cleanse while leaving the skin feeling nourished and comfortable. I would highly recommend the Dove Hypoallergenic Sensitive Body Wash to anyone looking for a gentle, moisturizing cleanser that’s safe for sensitive skin types.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great for sensitive noses
review_text:
I have a hard time finding smells that aren't too strong on soap. This leaves my skin feeing so soft and just a hint of fresh smell. Good price for the quality.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great shower wash, not great for bubble bath, unscented but NOT fragrance free
review_text:
I’ve been using this product for years. It’s great for dry skin or eczema.It may not eliminate the need for body lotion after your shower, but it is much milder than most liquid body soaps. It’s a great, affordable sulfate/paraben-free option.A few notes:1) It is “unscented” but not “fragrance free.” There is a very light fragrance added to mask the scent of the other ingredients. It smells pleasantly neutral & doesn’t linger. But if you truly need fragrance free products for allergy reasons, this ain’t it.2) It does not lather as well as other body washes, due to added moisturizers and lack of sulfates. It will still leave you feeling clean and fresh.3) Do not try to use it as a bubble bath. It won’t make bubbles at all. I still take baths with it, but I find that I have to first dispense it into a dish and swish it together with a little water before adding it to the bath. Otherwise “chunks” of product float in the water and it’s gross.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Sensitive body wash for my twins
review_text:
The pump dispenser is a nice touch, making it convenient to use in the shower without the hassle of flipping open a cap. A small amount goes a long way, and it spreads smoothly across the body without feeling heavy or greasy. It’s also fragrance-free, which is a big plus for my twins because they are sensitive to perfumes in some skincare products. It provides a thorough cleanse while leaving the skin feeling nourished and comfortable. I would highly recommend the Dove Hypoallergenic Sensitive Body Wash to anyone looking for a gentle, moisturizing cleanser that’s safe for sensitive skin types.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great shower wash, not great for bubble bath, unscented but NOT fragrance free
review_text:
I’ve been using this product for years. It’s great for dry skin or eczema.It may not eliminate the need for body lotion after your shower, but it is much milder than most liquid body soaps. It’s a great, affordable sulfate/paraben-free option.A few notes:1) It is “unscented” but not “fragrance free.” There is a very light fragrance added to mask the scent of the other ingredients. It smells pleasantly neutral & doesn’t linger. But if you truly need fragrance free products for allergy reasons, this ain’t it.2) It does not lather as well as other body washes, due to added moisturizers and lack of sulfates. It will still leave you feeling clean and fresh.3) Do not try to use it as a bubble bath. It won’t make bubbles at all. I still take baths with it, but I find that I have to first dispense it into a dish and swish it together with a little water before adding it to the bath. Otherwise “chunks” of product float in the water and it’s gross.
Read more

It smells pleasantly neutral & doesn’t linger. But if you truly need fragrance free products for allergy reasons, this ain’t it.2) It does not lather as well as other body washes, due to added moisturizers and lack of sulfates. It will still leave you feeling clean and fresh.3) Do not try to use it as a bubble bath. It won’t make bubbles at all. I still take baths with it, but I find that I have to first dispense it into a dish and swish it together with a little water before adding it to the bath. Otherwise “chunks” of product float in the water and it’s gross.
Read more

A small amount goes a long way, and it spreads smoothly across the body without feeling heavy or greasy. It’s also fragrance-free, which is a big plus for my twins because they are sensitive to perfumes in some skincare products. It provides a thorough cleanse while leaving the skin feeling nourished and comfortable. I would highly recommend the Dove Hypoallergenic Sensitive Body Wash to anyone looking for a gentle, moisturizing cleanser that’s safe for sensitive skin types.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great shower wash, not great for bubble bath, unscented but NOT fragrance free
review_text:
I’ve been using this product for years. It’s great for dry skin or eczema.It may not eliminate the need for body lotion after your shower, but it is much milder than most liquid body soaps. It’s a great, affordable sulfate/paraben-free option.A few notes:1) It is “unscented” but not “fragrance free.” There is a very light fragrance added to mask the scent of the other ingredients. It smells pleasantly neutral & doesn’t linger. But if you truly need fragrance free products for allergy reasons, this ain’t it.2) It does not lather as well as other body washes, due to added moisturizers and lack of sulfates. It will still leave you feeling clean and fresh.3) Do not try to use it as a bubble bath. It won’t make bubbles at all. I still take baths with it, but I find that I have to first dispense it into a dish and swish it together with a little water before adding it to the bath. Otherwise “chunks” of product float in the water and it’s gross.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Love this
review_text:
This soaps up really nicely. It has a very slight fragrance and smells great. And I can feel it moisturizing my skin while using it and afterwards as well. I always loves using Dove soap bars but now love the convenience of a liquid in a pump bottle.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Sensitive body wash for my twins
review_text:
The pump dispenser is a nice touch, making it convenient to use in the shower without the hassle of flipping open a cap. A small amount goes a long way, and it spreads smoothly across the body without feeling heavy or greasy. It’s also fragrance-free, which is a big plus for my twins because they are sensitive to perfumes in some skincare products. It provides a thorough cleanse while leaving the skin feeling nourished and comfortable. I would highly recommend the Dove Hypoallergenic Sensitive Body Wash to anyone looking for a gentle, moisturizing cleanser that’s safe for sensitive skin types.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great for sensitive noses
review_text:
I have a hard time finding smells that aren't too strong on soap. This leaves my skin feeing so soft and just a hint of fresh smell. Good price for the quality.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great shower wash, not great for bubble bath, unscented but NOT fragrance free
review_text:
I’ve been using this product for years. It’s great for dry skin or eczema.It may not eliminate the need for body lotion after your shower, but it is much milder than most liquid body soaps. It’s a great, affordable sulfate/paraben-free option.A few notes:1) It is “unscented” but not “fragrance free.” There is a very light fragrance added to mask the scent of the other ingredients. It smells pleasantly neutral & doesn’t linger. But if you truly need fragrance free products for allergy reasons, this ain’t it.2) It does not lather as well as other body washes, due to added moisturizers and lack of sulfates. It will still leave you feeling clean and fresh.3) Do not try to use it as a bubble bath. It won’t make bubbles at all. I still take baths with it, but I find that I have to first dispense it into a dish and swish it together with a little water before adding it to the bath. Otherwise “chunks” of product float in the water and it’s gross.
Read more

But if you truly need fragrance free products for allergy reasons, this ain’t it.2) It does not lather as well as other body washes, due to added moisturizers and lack of sulfates. It will still leave you feeling clean and fresh.3) Do not try to use it as a bubble bath. It won’t make bubbles at all. I still take baths with it, but I find that I have to first dispense it into a dish and swish it together with a little water before adding it to the bath. Otherwise “chunks” of product float in the water and it’s gross.
Read more

It’s also fragrance-free, which is a big plus for my twins because they are sensitive to perfumes in some skincare products. It provides a thorough cleanse while leaving the skin feeling nourished and comfortable. I would highly recommend the Dove Hypoallergenic Sensitive Body Wash to anyone looking for a gentle, moisturizing cleanser that’s safe for sensitive skin types.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great shower wash, not great for bubble bath, unscented but NOT fragrance free
review_text:
I’ve been using this product for years. It’s great for dry skin or eczema.It may not eliminate the need for body lotion after your shower, but it is much milder than most liquid body soaps. It’s a great, affordable sulfate/paraben-free option.A few notes:1) It is “unscented” but not “fragrance free.” There is a very light fragrance added to mask the scent of the other ingredients. It smells pleasantly neutral & doesn’t linger. But if you truly need fragrance free products for allergy reasons, this ain’t it.2) It does not lather as well as other body washes, due to added moisturizers and lack of sulfates. It will still leave you feeling clean and fresh.3) Do not try to use it as a bubble bath. It won’t make bubbles at all. I still take baths with it, but I find that I have to first dispense it into a dish and swish it together with a little water before adding it to the bath. Otherwise “chunks” of product float in the water and it’s gross.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Love this
review_text:
This soaps up really nicely. It has a very slight fragrance and smells great. And I can feel it moisturizing my skin while using it and afterwards as well. I always loves using Dove soap bars but now love the convenience of a liquid in a pump bottle.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Sensitive body wash for my twins
review_text:
The pump dispenser is a nice touch, making it convenient to use in the shower without the hassle of flipping open a cap. A small amount goes a long way, and it spreads smoothly across the body without feeling heavy or greasy. It’s also fragrance-free, which is a big plus for my twins because they are sensitive to perfumes in some skincare products. It provides a thorough cleanse while leaving the skin feeling nourished and comfortable. I would highly recommend the Dove Hypoallergenic Sensitive Body Wash to anyone looking for a gentle, moisturizing cleanser that’s safe for sensitive skin types.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great for sensitive noses
review_text:
I have a hard time finding smells that aren't too strong on soap. This leaves my skin feeing so soft and just a hint of fresh smell. Good price for the quality.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great shower wash, not great for bubble bath, unscented but NOT fragrance free
review_text:
I’ve been using this product for years. It’s great for dry skin or eczema.It may not eliminate the need for body lotion after your shower, but it is much milder than most liquid body soaps. It’s a great, affordable sulfate/paraben-free option.A few notes:1) It is “unscented” but not “fragrance free.” There is a very light fragrance added to mask the scent of the other ingredients. It smells pleasantly neutral & doesn’t linger. But if you truly need fragrance free products for allergy reasons, this ain’t it.2) It does not lather as well as other body washes, due to added moisturizers and lack of sulfates. It will still leave you feeling clean and fresh.3) Do not try to use it as a bubble bath. It won’t make bubbles at all. I still take baths with it, but I find that I have to first dispense it into a dish and swish it together with a little water before adding it to the bath. Otherwise “chunks” of product float in the water and it’s gross.
Read more

But if you truly need fragrance free products for allergy reasons, this ain’t it.2) It does not lather as well as other body washes, due to added moisturizers and lack of sulfates. It will still leave you feeling clean and fresh.3) Do not try to use it as a bubble bath. It won’t make bubbles at all. I still take baths with it, but I find that I have to first dispense it into a dish and swish it together with a little water before adding it to the bath. Otherwise “chunks” of product float in the water and it’s gross.
Read more

It’s also fragrance-free, which is a big plus for my twins because they are sensitive to perfumes in some skincare products. It provides a thorough cleanse while leaving the skin feeling nourished and comfortable. I would highly recommend the Dove Hypoallergenic Sensitive Body Wash to anyone looking for a gentle, moisturizing cleanser that’s safe for sensitive skin types.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great shower wash, not great for bubble bath, unscented but NOT fragrance free
review_text:
I’ve been using this product for years. It’s great for dry skin or eczema.It may not eliminate the need for body lotion after your shower, but it is much milder than most liquid body soaps. It’s a great, affordable sulfate/paraben-free option.A few notes:1) It is “unscented” but not “fragrance free.” There is a very light fragrance added to mask the scent of the other ingredients. It smells pleasantly neutral & doesn’t linger. But if you truly need fragrance free products for allergy reasons, this ain’t it.2) It does not lather as well as other body washes, due to added moisturizers and lack of sulfates. It will still leave you feeling clean and fresh.3) Do not try to use it as a bubble bath. It won’t make bubbles at all. I still take baths with it, but I find that I have to first dispense it into a dish and swish it together with a little water before adding it to the bath. Otherwise “chunks” of product float in the water and it’s gross.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Sensitive body wash for my twins
review_text:
The pump dispenser is a nice touch, making it convenient to use in the shower without the hassle of flipping open a cap. A small amount goes a long way, and it spreads smoothly across the body without feeling heavy or greasy. It’s also fragrance-free, which is a big plus for my twins because they are sensitive to perfumes in some skincare products. It provides a thorough cleanse while leaving the skin feeling nourished and comfortable. I would highly recommend the Dove Hypoallergenic Sensitive Body Wash to anyone looking for a gentle, moisturizing cleanser that’s safe for sensitive skin types.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great shower wash, not great for bubble bath, unscented but NOT fragrance free
review_text:
I’ve been using this product for years. It’s great for dry skin or eczema.It may not eliminate the need for body lotion after your shower, but it is much milder than most liquid body soaps. It’s a great, affordable sulfate/paraben-free option.A few notes:1) It is “unscented” but not “fragrance free.” There is a very light fragrance added to mask the scent of the other ingredients. It smells pleasantly neutral & doesn’t linger. But if you truly need fragrance free products for allergy reasons, this ain’t it.2) It does not lather as well as other body washes, due to added moisturizers and lack of sulfates. It will still leave you feeling clean and fresh.3) Do not try to use it as a bubble bath. It won’t make bubbles at all. I still take baths with it, but I find that I have to first dispense it into a dish and swish it together with a little water before adding it to the bath. Otherwise “chunks” of product float in the water and it’s gross.
Read more

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
My Go To Body Wash for Years - Deeply Moisturizing and Convenient
review_text:
I have been purchasing the Dove Body Wash with Pump Deep Moisture for years through Amazon's autoship program, and it continues to be my favorite body wash. This product is perfect for my dry skin, providing deep and lasting moisture that keeps my skin feeling soft and hydrated all day long.The 24hr Renewing MicroMoisture technology is incredibly effective, and I can feel the difference in my skin’s texture and hydration after each use. The formula is gentle, lathers well, and rinses off easily without leaving any residue.The pump dispenser is a great feature, making it convenient to use in the shower and ensuring that I get the right amount of product every time. I love the subtle, clean scent that isn’t overpowering but leaves me feeling fresh.Overall, I highly recommend the Dove Deep Moisture Body Wash to anyone with dry skin or anyone looking for a reliable, moisturizing cleanser. It’s been a staple in my shower routine for years, and I wouldn’t consider switching to anything else.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Dove is Good, but EVIL GOODS is Amazing
review_text:
Dove Body Wash with Pump  caught my attention as a reliable way to take care of my skin. It's a solid choice, especially for someone looking for a hypoallergenic, paraben-free, sulfate-free, and cruelty-free moisturizing cleanser. The convenience factor is great – just pump out a bit and you’re set for a refreshing, nourishing wash.However, after trying EVIL GOODS Whipped Beef Tallow and Honey Balm, I realized it aligned more closely with my lifestyle and skin care needs. EVIL GOODS not only provides the deep hydration I crave but also supports overall skin health with its unique blend of ingredients. This is significant for me. The inclusion of honey adds an extra layer of moisture and healing properties that make a noticeable difference. Plus, the grass-fed, grass-finished beef tallow feels richer and more luxurious, providing a deeper level of nourishment that lasts throughout the day. I got EVIL GOODS on Amazon too for anyone wondering: 
The experience of using evil goods also feels more tailored to an adult's needs. It's not just about moisturizing; it's about enhancing skin health in a way that aligns with my overall wellness goals. While Dove is great for providing basic hydration, EVIL GOODS feels like it's doing more for my skin.Dove  definitely has its perks. It's a fantastic choice for those looking for a straightforward, gentle cleanser without any added fragrances or harsh chemicals. The hypoallergenic formula is particularly beneficial for those with sensitive skin, offering a soothing and effective way to cleanse and nourish the skin. It’s also great for people who prefer a minimalist skincare routine. The convenience of this body wash, with its easy-to-use pump, can't be overstated – it’s perfect for quick and hassle-free use. Plus, being paraben-free, sulfate-free, and cruelty-free, it offers a healthier option for those who want to avoid synthetic ingredients and support ethical products.While Dove Body Wash is a convenient and effective way to hydrate and cleanse your skin, for someone like me who’s looking for that extra edge in terms of skin health and overall wellness, the EVIL GOODS  Balm is the way to go. It offers a comprehensive approach to skincare, specifically geared towards enhancing and maintaining healthy skin with natural, high-quality ingredients, and that’s something I truly value. If you want to take your skincare to the next level and experience amazing results, EVIL GOODS is definitely worth the investment.
Read more

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
This DOVE skin product does not disappoint
review_text:
It is a creamy, moisturizing, gently scented soap that doesn’t leave a heavy residue on the skin or the shower walls/floor/doors. The larger bottle size is helpful, however I couldn’t rate this product 5 stars because it’s a bit difficult to get the last 1 1/2” of soap out of the bottle. The pump feature doesn’t give the consumer the ability to just tip the bottle upside down to use the remaining amount of soap. I will continue to use this product.

My Go To Body Wash for Years - Deeply Moisturizing and Convenient
review_text:
I have been purchasing the Dove Body Wash with Pump Deep Moisture for years through Amazon's autoship program, and it continues to be my favorite body wash. This product is perfect for my dry skin, providing deep and lasting moisture that keeps my skin feeling soft and hydrated all day long.The 24hr Renewing MicroMoisture technology is incredibly effective, and I can feel the difference in my skin’s texture and hydration after each use. The formula is gentle, lathers well, and rinses off easily without leaving any residue.The pump dispenser is a great feature, making it convenient to use in the shower and ensuring that I get the right amount of product every time. I love the subtle, clean scent that isn’t overpowering but leaves me feeling fresh.Overall, I highly recommend the Dove Deep Moisture Body Wash to anyone with dry skin or anyone looking for a reliable, moisturizing cleanser. It’s been a staple in my shower routine for years, and I wouldn’t consider switching to anything else.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Dove is Good, but EVIL GOODS is Amazing
review_text:
Dove Body Wash with Pump  caught my attention as a reliable way to take care of my skin. It's a solid choice, especially for someone looking for a hypoallergenic, paraben-free, sulfate-free, and cruelty-free moisturizing cleanser. The convenience factor is great – just pump out a bit and you’re set for a refreshing, nourishing wash.However, after trying EVIL GOODS Whipped Beef Tallow and Honey Balm, I realized it aligned more closely with my lifestyle and skin care needs. EVIL GOODS not only provides the deep hydration I crave but also supports overall skin health with its unique blend of ingredients. This is significant for me. The inclusion of honey adds an extra layer of moisture and healing properties that make a noticeable difference. Plus, the grass-fed, grass-finished beef tallow feels richer and more luxurious, providing a deeper level of nourishment that lasts throughout the day. I got EVIL GOODS on Amazon too for anyone wondering: 
The experience of using evil goods also feels more tailored to an adult's needs. It's not just about moisturizing; it's about enhancing skin health in a way that aligns with my overall wellness goals. While Dove is great for providing basic hydration, EVIL GOODS feels like it's doing more for my skin.Dove  definitely has its perks. It's a fantastic choice for those looking for a straightforward, gentle cleanser without any added fragrances or harsh chemicals. The hypoallergenic formula is particularly beneficial for those with sensitive skin, offering a soothing and effective way to cleanse and nourish the skin. It’s also great for people who prefer a minimalist skincare routine. The convenience of this body wash, with its easy-to-use pump, can't be overstated – it’s perfect for quick and hassle-free use. Plus, being paraben-free, sulfate-free, and cruelty-free, it offers a healthier option for those who want to avoid synthetic ingredients and support ethical products.While Dove Body Wash is a convenient and effective way to hydrate and cleanse your skin, for someone like me who’s looking for that extra edge in terms of skin health and overall wellness, the EVIL GOODS  Balm is the way to go. It offers a comprehensive approach to skincare, specifically geared towards enhancing and maintaining healthy skin with natural, high-quality ingredients, and that’s something I truly value. If you want to take your skincare to the next level and experience amazing results, EVIL GOODS is definitely worth the investment.
Read more

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
This DOVE skin product does not disappoint
review_text:
It is a creamy, moisturizing, gently scented soap that doesn’t leave a heavy residue on the skin or the shower walls/floor/doors. The larger bottle size is helpful, however I couldn’t rate this product 5 stars because it’s a bit difficult to get the last 1 1/2” of soap out of the bottle. The pump feature doesn’t give the consumer the ability to just tip the bottle upside down to use the remaining amount of soap. I will continue to use this product.
